title: Ticket #3427: Lark bridge mode routes don't make sense.
description:
At UNL, if a default route is created inside the network namespace, things work only if there is no gateway specified.

At UW, if a default route is created inside the network namespace, things work only if a gateway is specified.

Clearly, there's something more heinous going on inside Linux routing which we don't understand.
remarks:
2013-Jan-11 20:58:11 by bbockelm:
Hi Todd -

I have a theory. One difference between the UNL and UW setup is the bridge has a default route in the UNL setup.

Does the need for manually adding the default route from the job itself go away if you add the default route via the bridge?

Brian
